key_points: Nearly 9 million Californians are set to receive a third batch of Golden State Stimulus II payments starting Oct. 5.
These payments are part of California's $100 billion California Comeback Plan.
Eligibility for the $600 payments has expanded under Golden State Stimulus II compared to the initial round of payments.
Qualifying families with dependents could receive an additional $500, bringing their total potential relief to $1,100.
Eligibility for these payments requires being a California resident for more than half of the 2020 tax year and having filed 2020 taxes by Oct. 15, 2021.
Income limits for eligibility are set at $75,000 or less for the 2020 tax year, and recipients cannot be claimed as a dependent by another taxpayer.
Direct deposit payments are expected before Oct. 31, while paper checks will be distributed between Oct. 6 and January of the following year.
Stimulus payments will be sent out approximately every two weeks.
Paper check delivery is organized by the last three digits of recipients' ZIP codes as listed on their 2020 tax return.
State stimulus payments are protected from being seized for debts like child support or owed to state agencies.
